content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata>  <idinfo>   <citation>    <citeinfo>     <origin>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</origin>     <pubdate>20120829</pubdate>     <title>Threatened Eider Geodatabase, Survey Polygons.  Arctic LCC (2012)</title>     <edition>2012</edition>     <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>     <pubinfo>      <pubplace>Fairbanks, AK</pubplace>      <publish>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</publish>     </pubinfo>     <othercit>Users are strongly encouraged to cite original data sources whenever they extract information from the larger dataset for specific analysis.</othercit>     <onlink>http://arcticlcc.org/products/</onlink>    </citeinfo>   </citation>   <descript>    <abstract>This polygon feature class represent areas surveyed for threatened eiders and is one component of the Threatened Eider Geodatabase. This database is intended to be a qualitative "first look" at where these two species of eider have been recorded and where surveys have been conducted. This spatial dataset is intended for general planning and mapping purposes rather than for deriving density estimates. The geodatabase is comprised of two feature classes (SPEI_STEI_Observations and Survey_Polys) and two tables (Eider_Incidental_attributes and Eider_Reference_Information).</abstract>    <purpose>The Arctic LCC created the Threatened Eider Geodatabase to serve as a primary repository for threatened eider distribution information.  This database is intended to be a qualitative "first look" at where these two species of eider have been recorded and where surveys have been conducted.  This dataset is intended for general planning and mapping purposes, it should NOT be used for deriving density estimates.  Users are reminded that these data do not represent all locations within the geographic scope of this database that may be occupied by threatened eiders.</purpose>    <supplinf>Observations of eiders are considered to have been derived from a survey if both of the following conditions are met 1) there was a search area with reasonably well-defined boundaries, and 2) eiders were among the taxa specifically targeted by the survey.  All observations of eiders that do not meet these criteria are treated as incidental observations - these could include observations contributed by persons engaged in activities other than wildlife surveys, observations obtained during the course of biological survey work targeted at another species such as caribou, and historical observations from the literature.  Observations associated with surveys are related to the Survey_Polys feature class via the SURVEY_ID field that uniquely identifies each survey.   A survey is defined as a defined geographic area under observation for a discrete time period.  For example, an area surveyed annually will have a separate record for each survey-year.  Within-year replicates are also listed as separate surveys unless the data are summarized by year.  Incidental observations are assigned the non-unique value Incidental  in the SURVEY_ID field and are related to the Eider_Incidental_Attributes table via a unique value in the Incd_ID field.</supplinf>   </descript>   <timeperd>    <timeinfo>     <rngdates>      <begdate>1991</begdate>      <enddate>2010</enddate>     </rngdates>    </timeinfo>    <current>ground condition</current>   </timeperd>   <status>    <progress>Complete</progress>    <update>As needed</update>   </status>   <spdom>    <bounding>     <westbc>-135.0</westbc>     <eastbc>-135.0</eastbc>     <northbc>74.4</northbc>     <southbc>66.5</southbc>    </bounding>   </spdom>   <keywords>    <theme>     <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt>     <themekey>biota</themekey>    </theme>    <theme>     <themekt>User</themekt>     <themekey>Steller's eiders</themekey>     <themekey>spectacled eiders</themekey>     <themekey>eider observations</themekey>     <themekey>survey</themekey>    </theme>    <place>     <placekt>None</placekt>     <placekey>Alaska</placekey>    </place>   </keywords>   <accconst>None.</accconst>   <useconst>Neither the Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative or contributors to this dataset shall be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.  In an effort to provide the most comprehensive overview possible, we have incorporated many data sources, representing many different survey methods. It is not possible to apply a uniform quantification of survey effort across this wide variety of data sets because not all of the eider observations are associated with a clearly defined survey area. Therefore, the user should avoid aggregating data from multiple sources to derive density estimates. When interpreting these data, users are reminded to consider that detectability of eiders is a function of many variables, including differences in species, habitat, time-of-year, weather conditions, and survey techniques. Inherent in any data set used to develop graphical representations, are limitations of accuracy as determined by, among others, the source, scale and resolution of the data.</useconst>   <ptcontac>    <cntinfo>     <cntorgp>      <cntorg>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</cntorg>     </cntorgp>     <cntpos>Geospatial Specialist</cntpos>     <cntaddr>      <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype>      <address>101 12th Ave.</address>      <city>Fairbanks</city>      <state>Alaska</state>      <postal>99701</postal>     </cntaddr>     <cntvoice>907 456 0327</cntvoice>     <cntemail>data@arcticlcc.org</cntemail>     <cntinst>Contact by phone or email.</cntinst>    </cntinfo>   </ptcontac>   <datacred>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</datacred>   <secinfo>    <secsys>FIPS Pub 199</secsys>    <secclass>No Confidentiality</secclass>    <sechandl>Standard Technical Controls</sechandl>   </secinfo>   <native>Microsoft Windows 7; ESRI ArcGIS 10</native>  </idinfo>  <dataqual>   <logic>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative (Arctic LCC) staff and contractors have compiled this dataset to the best of their abilities using the resources available to them.  Although the data have been gathered by sources believed to be reliable, Arctic LCC neither verifies nor guarantees the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data.   If you find any errors or omissions, we encourage you to report them to the Arctic LCC data custodian (data@arcticlcc.org).</logic>   <complete>Users are reminded that these data do not represent all pair</plance></planci></planar></horizsys>  </spref>  <eainfo>   <detailed Name="Survey_Polys">    <enttyp>     <enttypl>Survey_Polys</enttypl>     <enttypd>This feature class represents survey areas.</enttypd>     <enttypds>Arctic LCC</enttypds>    </enttyp>    <attr>     <attrlabl>OBJECTID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Internal feature number.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Shape</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Feature geometry.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Survey_ID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Required.  Unique identifier for each survey.  A survey will be assigned a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdSURVEY_ID\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd only if eiders are one of the targeted species or survey methods are such that there is a reasonable probability that the presence of eiders would be detected.  The \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdSURVEY_ID\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd will be a combination of contributor (limited to a maximum of 6 characters) underscore year (YYYY) underscore purpose code (PN, NE, BR, BP, MO; see \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdPurpose\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd for code definitions) underscore survey # (sequential).  Examples:  ABR_2005_BP_001, ABR_2005_BP_002, and FWS_2005_PN_001.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Free text</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Survey_Loc</attrlabl>     <attrdef>General description of the survey location.  For example, Barrow Triangle, Alpine, Prudhoe Bay.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Free text</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Survey_Name</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Name of the survey. For example, Eider breeding population survey Arctic Coastal Plain.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Free text</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Ref_ID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Identifies the record, within the Eider_References_Information table that is associated with a survey.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Positive whole numbers</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Start_Date</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Start date of survey (MM/DD/YYYY).</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Dates</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>End_Date</attrlabl>     <attrdef>End date of survey (MM/DD/YYYY).</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Dates</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Start_Year</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Year survey started (YYYY).</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Positive whole numbers</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>End_Year</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Year survey ended (YYYY).  Only those surveys that start in December of one year and end in January of the next year will have different start and end years.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Positive whole numbers</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Type_</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Describes the type of survey: aerial or ground</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Free text</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Platform</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Describes the platform used for the survey: fixed-wing, helicopter, non-motorized, motorized.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Free text</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Purpose</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Biological purpose of the survey.  Classified as pre-nesting (PN), nesting (NE), brood-rearing (BR), breeding pair (BP), and molting (MO), or spans multiple time periods, such as brood-rearing and molting (SP).</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <edom>       <edomv>PN</edomv>       <edomvd>pre-nesting</edomvd>       <edomvds>Arctic LCC</edomvds>      </edom>     </attrdomv>     <attrdomv>      <edom>       <edomv>NE</edomv>       <edomvd>nesting</edomvd>       <edomvds>Arctic LCC</edomvds>      </edom>     </attrdomv>     <attrdomv>      <edom>       <edomv>BR</edomv>       <edomvd>brood-rearing</edomvd>       <edomvds>Arctic LCC</edomvds>      </edom>     </attrdomv>     <attrdomv>      <edom>       <edomv>BP</edomv>       <edomvd>breeding pair</edomvd>       <edomvds>Arctic LCC</edomvds>      </edom>     </attrdomv>     <attrdomv>      <edom>       <edomv>MO</edomv>       <edomvd>molt</edomvd>       <edomvds>Arctic LCC</edomvds>      </edom>     </attrdomv>     <attrdomv>      <edom>       <edomv>SP</edomv>       <edomvd>spans multiple periods</edomvd>       <edomvds>Arctic LCC</edomvds>      </edom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Coverage</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Describes how thoroughly an area was searched.  Classified as sample, census, incomplete, or unknown.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <edom>       <edomv>sample</edomv>       <edomvd>sample</edomvd>       <edomvds>Arctic LCC</edomvds>      </edom>     </attrdomv>     <attrdomv>      <edom>       <edomv>census</edomv>       <edomvd>census</edomvd>       <edomvds>Arctic LCC</edomvds>      </edom>     </attrdomv>     <attrdomv>      <edom>       <edomv>incomplete</edomv>       <edomvd>incomplete</edomvd>       <edomvds>Arctic LCC</edomvds>      </edom>     </attrdomv>     <attrdomv>      <edom>       <edomv>unknown</edomv>       <edomvd>unknown</edomvd>       <edomvds>Arctic LCC</edomvds>      </edom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Replicate</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Replicate number, if applicable.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Positive whole number</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Map_Mthd</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Method used to map the observation area, if known.  Classified as topo, aerial photo, satellite image, GPS, or a combination of these.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Free text</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Error_Ind</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Indicator of accuracy.  May be scale of map or photo (for example; 1:250,000, 1:63,360, 1"=500') or precision of GPS coordinates (for example; averaged, instantaneous, averaged from a distance, averaged on-top the point, and instantaneous on-top the point).</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Free text</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Null_Svy</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Describes whether or not STEI and/or SPEC were seen during the survey.  If eiders were NOT detected, this field contains a Y.  If eiders were detected, this field contains a N.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Arctic LCC</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <edom>       <edomv>Y</edomv>       <edomvd>Yes</edomvd>       <edomvds>Arctic
